definition: to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge
to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)
to turn a blind eye to
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
to whine on for days (idiom)/to endlessly grumble complaints/incessant whining
to counter every move/to be full of tricks
pavilion in the air (idiom); unrealistic Utopian construction/castles in Spain/imaginary future plans
could happen at any moment/on the verge
to take turns/to work by roster
lit. dragons and snakes mingle (idiom)/fig. a mix of good people and scumbags
lit. severe floods and fierce beasts (idiom)/fig. great scourges/extremely dangerous or threatening things
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
